comment:
* Represents an ad and its corresponding bid value after the bid generation step in the ad * selection process. * *

The ads and their bids are fed into an ad scoring process which will inform the final ad * selection. The currency unit for the bid is expected to be the same requested by the seller when * initiating the selection process and not specified in this class. The seller can provide the * currency via AdSelectionSignals. The currency is opaque to FLEDGE.

methods.name: public AdData getAdData()
methods.comment: * @return the ad that was bid on

methods.name: public double getBid()
methods.comment:
* The bid is the amount of money an advertiser has bid during the ad selection process to show * an ad. The bid could be any non-negative {@code double}, such as 0.00, 0.17, 1.10, or * 1000.00. * *

The currency for a bid would be controlled by Seller and will remain consistent across a * run of Ad selection. This could be achieved by leveraging bidding signals during * "generateBid()" phase and using the same currency during the creation of contextual ads. * Having currency unit as a dedicated field could be supported in future releases. * * @return the bid value to be passed to the scoring function when scoring the ad returned by * {@link #getAdData()}

methods.name: public void writeToParcel(@NonNull Parcel dest, int flags)

methodNames: public void writeToParcel(@NonNull Parcel dest, int flags)
